entries.text: Ansible is one of those snazzy tools that automate the installation and management of software/configuration/all the things on armies of machines. It's written in Python, but works well with components written in anything else.  Marcus Ramberg shows us how his Perl scripts interfaces with it using  Mojolicious.
entries.title: Building Ansible Modules with Perl and Mojolicious

entries.text: Elasticsearch default scoring doesn't quite do it for your special case? Despair not, for Mateu shows us here how to tweak the scoring algorithm in any way we want.

header: This week we have something that is bound to make our Windows-using brethren happy: berrybrew, a perlbrew/plenv equivalent for Strawberry Perl, by David Farrell. We also have a few nice grant reports. And, in the everlasting fun department, Sinan's playing with quines lead to dark archaeological discoveries about 'open' and 'autodie'. Enjoy!  Oh, and if you are based in Canada, happy Thanksgiving! ~ `/anick
subject: Some Berry Good News For Windows Users
